-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHyperVSnapshot_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command '$ifw_api_command$'

16.description: Warning threshold for predicting the size of snapshots taken for each Vm before the partition becomes full.
16.caption: SnapshotSizePredictionWarning

7.description: Include only virtual machines that are currently running
7.caption: ActiveVms

5.description: Include only virtual machines with a specific name. Supports wildcard usage (*)
5.caption: IncludeVms

21.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
21.caption: Verbosity

18.description: Sets the CheckPackage CRITICAL if the Hyper-V VM has no snapshots.
18.caption: EmptySnapshotCritical

12.description:
Warning threshold for each individual vms total snapshots size. It is also possible to
enter e.g. 10% as threshold value, if you want a percentage comparison. Defaults to (B)
12.caption: TotalSnapshotSizeWarning

10.description: Warning threshold for each individual vms snapshots, how old they must be in seconds.
10.caption: CreationTimeWarning

2.description: Defines with which Execution Policy the PowerShell is started
2.caption: PowerShell Execution Policy

8.description: Warning threshold for each individual vms how many snapshots they may have.
8.caption: CountSnapshotWarning

17.description: Critical threshold for predicting the size of snapshots taken for each Vm before the partition becomes full.
17.caption: SnapshotSizePredictionCritical

11.description: Critical threshold for each individual vms snapshots, how old they must be in seconds.
11.caption: CreationTimeCritical

9.description: Critical threshold for each individual vms how many snapshots they may have
9.caption: CountSnapshotCritical

14.description: Warning threshold for each individual vms snapshot size in Byte.
14.caption: SnapshotSizeWarning

20.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin.
20.caption: NoPerfData

15.description: Critical threshold for each individual vms snapshot size in Byte.
15.caption: SnapshotSizeCritical

6.description: Exclude virtual machines with a specific name. Supports wildcard usage (*)
6.caption: ExcludeVms

4.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/110-Installation/06-Collect-Metrics-over-Time/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
4.caption: ThresholdInterval

19.description:
Overrides the default behaviour of the plugin in case no virtual machine is present on the system.
Instead of returning `Unknown` the plugin will return `Ok` instead if this argument is set.
19.caption: AvoidEmptyCheck

13.description:
Critical threshold for each individual vms total snapshots size. It is also possible to
enter e.g. 10% as threshold value, if you want a percentage comparison. Defaults to (B)
13.caption: TotalSnapshotSizeCritical
